Package com.Game.utils

Class MapLoader

java.lang.Object
com.Game.utils.MapLoader
public class MapLoader extends Object
Loads a game map from a file. The map consists of continents, countries (territories), and borders (neighbor relationships). This class is responsible for parsing the map file, validating its format, and storing the data in a Map object.

  • Method Details

    • getLoadedMap

      public Map getLoadedMap()
      Gets the loaded map.
      Returns:
      The loaded map object.

    • setLoadedMap

      Sets the loaded map.
      Parameters:
      p_loadedMap - The map to set as loaded.

    • resetLoadedMap

      public void resetLoadedMap()
      Resets the loaded map.

    • read

      public void read(String p_fileName)
      Reads a map from a file.
      Parameters:
      p_fileName - The name of the map file to read.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(String p_mapFile)
      Validates the format of a map file by checking the structure of its sections: [continents], [countries], and [borders].
      Parameters:
      p_mapFile - The name of the map file to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the map file is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateMap

      public boolean validateMap()
      Validates the map by checking if both the map and continents are valid. This method defaults to printing the validation message.
      Returns:
      true if both the map and continents are valid, false otherwise.

    • validateMap

      public boolean validateMap(boolean p_showMsg)
      Validates the map by checking if both the map and continents are valid. Optionally prints the validation result message based on the value of showMsg.
      Parameters:
      p_showMsg - a boolean indicating whether to display the validation message (true to display, false to suppress).
      Returns:
      true if both the map and continents are valid, false otherwise.

    • isMapExist

      public BufferedReader isMapExist(String p_mapFile)
      Checks if a map file exists either locally or as a resource, and returns a BufferedReader to read it. If the file does not exist or cannot be found, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      p_mapFile - the path or name of the map file to be checked.
      Returns:
      a BufferedReader for reading the map file if it exists, null otherwise.
